isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics - Pin-Point Diagnostics

svcproc.title: Voltage Checks - Connectors

caution.para: The ECM harness connectors must be properly seated and the connector latched to avoid possible driveability or no-start conditions. Installing ECM connectors on an angle may cause an improper connection, misdiagnosis, and damaged components. Install the connector until the lever pivots and seats. Apply light pressure to position the connector on the ECM and then fully seat connector.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON (do not crank the engine).
Plug correct breakout harness into the harness connector.
Measure voltage at each pin with a DMM.
Compare sensor or actuator voltage readings with the expected voltages listed in the diagnostic table in this section for circuits being tested, this test will verify circuit integrity.
If a breakout harness is not available, use the correct tool from Terminal Test Adapter Kit. Do not directly probe the connector terminals with the DMM leads.

svcproc.para: For circuits without an expected voltage, this test will determine if that circuit is shorted or miss-wired to V REF, B+ or other voltage sources.
